DOC.HEAD: Romania's 11-Day Revolution
With PM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Key events in the Romania's popular uprising:
Dec. 15 _ Demonstrators ring a chuch in Timisoara, in western Romania, to prevent security forces from arresting a dissident clergyman who was active in promoting the rights of ethnic Hungarians.
Dec. 16-17 _ Security forces open fire on thousands of demonstators in Timisoara, who have expanded their protest to demand freedom and a better life. Hundreds are buried in mass graves.
Dec. 18 _ The United States issues a formal protest over the use of force in Timisoara.
Dec. 19 _ More shooting is reported in Timisoara. Britain, Poland's parliament and Soviet Foreign Minister Eduard Shevardnadze condemn the violence.

Wednesday _ President Nicolae Ceausescu, returning from a state visit to Iran, declares a state of emergency in western Romania and blames the unrest on ``facist, reactionary groups.'' Protests spread to at least eight other cities and in Timisoara tens of thousands of people take to the streets, chanting ``Give us our dead!''

Thursday _ The revolution spreads to the capital, and security forces open fire on protesters. Ceausescu is shouted down while addressing what he had planned as an orchestrated rally. State television shows his shocked face.

Friday _ Army units join the rebellion, and a group known as the National Salvation Committee announces it has overthown Ceausescu and will form a provincial government. It says it will try leaders of his 24-year-old regime and restore democracy. Ceausescu and his wife, Elena, flee the presidential palace by helicopter. The United States and European nations applaud his ouster.

Saturday _ The provisional government says the Ceausescus are captured in a town north of Bucharest. Savage street fighting takes place between the army, which backs to the new government, and elements of the hated secret police, loyal to Ceausescu.
Sunday _ Fierce street fighting continues in the capital and other cities.

Monday _ State radio announces the execution of Ceausescu and his wife after a secret trial that found them guilty of genocide and plundering more than $1 billion. The United States, the Soviet Union and other major powers recognize the provisional government. Romanians openly celebrate their first Christmas in four decades.
